description: NexusBlobStore is the Schema for the nexusblobstores API.

apiVersion.description:
APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object.
Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and
may reject unrecognized values.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description:
Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents.
Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to.
Cannot be updated.
In CamelCase.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: NexusBlobStoreSpec defines the desired state of NexusBlobStore.

path.description:
The path to the blobstore contents.
This can be an absolute path to anywhere on the system Nexus Repository Manager has access to it or can be a path relative to the sonatype-work directory.

name.description:
Name of the BlobStore.
Name should be unique across all BlobStores.

nexusRef.description: NexusRef is a reference to Nexus custom resource.

kind.description: Kind specifies the kind of the Nexus resource.

name.description: Name specifies the name of the Nexus resource.

advancedBucketConnection.description: A custom endpoint URL, signer type and whether path style access is enabled.

endpoint.description: A custom endpoint URL for third party object stores using the S3 API.

forcePathStyle.description: Setting this flag will result in path-style access being used for all requests.

maxConnectionPoolSize.description: Setting this value will override the default connection pool size of Nexus of the s3 client for this blobstore.

signerType.description: An API signature version which may be required for third party object stores using the S3 API.

bucket.description: Details of the S3 bucket such as name and region.

expiration.description: How many days until deleted blobs are finally removed from the S3 bucket (-1 to disable).

name.description: The name of the S3 bucket.

prefix.description: The S3 blob store (i.e. S3 object) key prefix.

region.description: The AWS region to create a new S3 bucket in or an existing S3 bucket's region.

bucketSecurity.description: Security details for granting access the S3 API.

accessKeyId.description: An IAM access key ID for granting access to the S3 bucket.

configMapKeyRef.description: Selects a key of a ConfigMap.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

secretKeyRef.description: Selects a key of a secret.

key.description: The key of the secret to select from.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

role.description: An IAM role to assume in order to access the S3 bucket.

secretAccessKey.description: The secret access key associated with the specified IAM access key ID.

configMapKeyRef.description: Selects a key of a ConfigMap.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

secretKeyRef.description: Selects a key of a secret.

key.description: The key of the secret to select from.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

sessionToken.description: An AWS STS session token associated with temporary security credentials which grant access to the S3 bucket.

configMapKeyRef.description: Selects a key of a ConfigMap.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

secretKeyRef.description: Selects a key of a secret.

key.description: The key of the secret to select from.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

encryption.description: The type of encryption to use if any.

encryptionKey.description: If using KMS encryption, you can supply a Key ID. If left blank, then the default will be used.

encryptionType.description: The type of S3 server side encryption to use.

softQuota.description: Settings to control the soft quota.

status.description: NexusBlobStoreStatus defines the observed state of NexusBlobStore.

error.description: Error is an error message if something went wrong.

value.description: Value is a status of the blob store.
